verses.roman:
tato duḥsaṅgam utsṛjya
satsu sajjeta buddhimān
santa evāsya chindanti
mano-vyāsaṅgam uktibhiḥ

synonyms: tataḥ—therefore; duḥsaṅgam—bad association; utsṛjya—throwing away; satsu—to saintly devotees; sajjeta—he should become attached; buddhi-man—one who is intelligent; santaḥ—saintly persons; eva—only; asya—his; chindanti—cut off; manaḥ—of the mind; vyāsaṅgam—excessive attachment; uktibhiḥ—by their words.
translation: An intelligent person should therefore reject all bad association and instead take up the association of saintly devotees, whose words cut off the excessive attachment of one's mind.
